result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lamonte D Fonsceca

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lamonte D Fonsceca in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Lamonte D Fonsceca in custody.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

**JUDGE FEISS AND ALL PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference. Discussion placed on the record. Defense received discovery material and an offer from the State. Defense requested Final PreTrial and Jury Trial dates. Court ordered parties to submit their Motions in Limine, Jury Instructions, and Witness Lists by the Final PreTrial date. Any Motions are due by the Final PreTrial date. If the parties believe a necessary witness for the State or Defense requires independent representation, they are to make arrangements for that representation through the Public Defender's Office two (2) weeks in advance of the Final PreTrial. Court ordered case adjourned for Final PreTrial and Jury Trial. Case remains calendared in Branch 46. Final PreTrial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 9:00 am. Hearing will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building. Jury Trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am. Trial will be held in Room 113 of the Safety Building.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated 07-28-22; received and filed.

Defendant Lamonte D Fonseca in court, appear by video with attorney Jason Finding, appear by video for Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective J. Majerle.    State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 46.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.
JusticePoint PreTrial Services Supervision Report dated June 7, 2022; received and filed.

Defendant Lamonte D Fonseca in court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  John Daniel Flynn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. Defense moves to dismiss; motion is taken under advisement. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 4-28-2022

22RM021364  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
4-23-2022

Defendant has RELEASE PRIVILEGES for the following:
Medical, Legal, and Work at Makarios Logistics (Warehouse located at 5821 S. Pennsylvania Avenue, Cudahy, WI 53110).
Defendant must provide information to JusticePoint.   
All previously ordered conditions of Bail remain.

Defendant Lamonte D Fonseca in Court with Attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Joshua Miles Mathy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

**PARTIES APPEARED VIA ZOOM VIDEO CONFERENCE.**  
Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court MODIFIED CONDITIONS OF BAIL.
Case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm in Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.

JusticePoint contacted the Court regarding Electronic Monitoring (GPS).
Clerk contacted ADA Mathy via email to schedule hearing.
Bail/Bond hearing scheduled for April 26, 2022 at 04:00 pm.
Hearing will be held via Zoom Video Conference.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.T. and his family and their residence, all citizen witnesses referenced in the complaint and discovery materials (including WITNESS 1)

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; 24 hour curfew.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $15,000.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Lamonte D Fonsceca in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Lamonte D Fonsceca in custody.  Anthony White appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Lamonte D Fonsceca appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Feiss, Branch 46. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
